intro: Mesembryanthemum odoratum, commonly known as the sweet mesem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in the early morning and close by midday. The plant is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
